intro: Crotalaria leschenaultii, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria. Crotalaria leschenaultii typically grows in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and agricultural fields. Its seeds are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
